    <title><![CDATA[Bitumen upgrade still years away for Alberta oilsands]]></title>
    <link>https://www.ctvnews.ca/business/bitumen-upgrade-still-years-away-for-alberta-oilsands-1.3808471</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Two years after a blue-ribbon panel called on the Alberta government to encourage partial upgrading of bitumen from the oilsands to enhance value and free up more pipeline room for exports, the idea remains years away from commercialization.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Dan Healing]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.3808471</guid>
    <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 10:11:36 -0500</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 10:11:36 -0500</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="https://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.3805489.1518732765!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[A haul truck carrying a full load drives at an oilsands mine near Fort McMurray, Alta., in 2008. (Jeff McIntosh / THE CANADIAN PRESS)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Nunavut lagging behind in ramp-up to marijuana legislation]]></title>
    <link>https://www.ctvnews.ca/business/nunavut-lagging-behind-in-ramp-up-to-marijuana-legislation-1.3808475</link>
    <description><![CDATA[With marijuana legalization only months away, members of Nunavut's new government are finally discussing how the territory will handle the change.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Bob Weber]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.3808475</guid>
    <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 10:23:12 -0500</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 10:23:12 -0500</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="https://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.3807878.1518887113!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Flowering marijuana plants are pictured during a tour of Tweed in Smiths Falls, Ontario on Thursday, Jan. 21, 2016. (Sean Kilpatrick / THE CANADIAN PRESS)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Five things to watch for in the Canadian business world in the coming week]]></title>
    <link>https://www.ctvnews.ca/business/five-things-to-watch-for-in-the-canadian-business-world-in-the-coming-week-1.3806951</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Loblaw Co. Ltd. releases fourth-quarter and year-end results on Thursday. ]]></description>

              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Flying high: 100,000 pot plants flown from Ontario to B.C.]]></title>
    <link>https://www.ctvnews.ca/business/flying-high-100-000-pot-plants-flown-from-ontario-to-b-c-1.3808316</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Under tight security, 100,000 marijuana plants arrived at Vancouver International Airport Saturday to be cultivated in a network of nearby greenhouses that’s being touted as the largest licensed cannabis production facility in the world. ]]></description>
    <author></author>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[CTVNews.ca Staff]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.3808316</guid>
    <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 21:50:17 -0500</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 21:50:17 -0500</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="https://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.3808318.1518921704!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Cannabis plants are wheeled into a marijuana production facility in Langley, B.C. on Feb. 17, 2018. (CTV Vancouver)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Canada won't act in 'impulsive way' in response to U.S. tax cuts: Morneau]]></title>
    <link>https://www.ctvnews.ca/business/canada-won-t-act-in-impulsive-way-in-response-to-u-s-tax-cuts-morneau-1.3806785</link>
    <description><![CDATA[The Liberal government will not "act in an impulsive way" in response to U.S. corporate tax cuts that economists say pose a threat to Canada's competitiveness, the federal finance minister said after a pre-budget meeting Friday.]]></description>
    <author></author>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.3806785</guid>
    <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 13:38:00 -0500</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 16:20:00 -0500</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="https://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.3806804.1518806254!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Minister of Finance Bill Morneau speaks to media after meeting with private sector economists, in Toronto on Friday, February 16, 2018. (THE CANADIAN PRESS/Christopher Katsarov)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Are female-led companies the answer to sexual misconduct?]]></title>
    <link>https://www.ctvnews.ca/business/are-female-led-companies-the-answer-to-sexual-misconduct-1.3807965</link>
    <description><![CDATA[In the wider business world, promoting more women to boards and the C-Suite is considered a critical step, but critics caution it is not enough, particularly when it comes to turning around companies engulfed in scandal.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Alexandra Olson]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Associated Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.3807965</guid>
    <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 14:51:00 -0500</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 14:55:00 -0500</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="https://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.3807969.1518896954!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[In this April 7, 2014 file photo, Maria Contreras-Sweet speaks during a ceremonial swearing in as Administrator of the Small Business Administration, in the South Court Auditorium on the White House complex in Washington. (Evan Vucci/AP Photo)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[B.C. to appeal NEB ruling on Trans Mountain bylaw]]></title>
    <link>https://www.ctvnews.ca/business/b-c-to-appeal-neb-ruling-on-trans-mountain-bylaw-1.3807958</link>
    <description><![CDATA[British Columbia's government is appealing a decision that allows Kinder Morgan Canada to bypass local regulations in constructing its Trans Mountain pipeline expansion.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Gemma Karstens-Smith]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.3807958</guid>
    <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 14:45:00 -0500</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 16:07:00 -0500</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="https://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.3807961.1518896675!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Pipes are seen at the Kinder Morgan Trans Mountain facility in Edmonton, Alta., Thursday, April 6, 2017. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Jonathan Hayward]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Manitoba selects mix of organizations to handle marijuana retail sales]]></title>
    <link>https://www.ctvnews.ca/business/manitoba-selects-mix-of-organizations-to-handle-marijuana-retail-sales-1.3806444</link>
    <description><![CDATA[The Manitoba government has selected a mix of organizations to handle retail sales of recreational pot when it is legalized across Canada later this year, including licensed producers, a medical clinic operator and First Nations communities.]]></description>
    <author></author>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.3806444</guid>
    <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 10:07:09 -0500</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 10:07:09 -0500</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="https://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.3728645.1515787210!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[In this file photo, a young man smokes a marijuana joint during a rally in downtown Vancouver. (THE CANADIAN PRESS/Darryl Dyck)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Burnaby seeks appeal over tree cutting permits involving Trans Mountain pipeline]]></title>
    <link>https://www.ctvnews.ca/business/burnaby-seeks-appeal-over-tree-cutting-permits-involving-trans-mountain-pipeline-1.3807069</link>
    <description><![CDATA[The City of Burnaby wants to appeal a National Energy Board decision that exempts Kinder Morgan from local land and tree clearance bylaws in the expansion of the Trans Mountain pipeline.]]></description>
    <author></author>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.3807069</guid>
    <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 16:27:16 -0500</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 16:27:16 -0500</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="https://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.3571477.1504263995!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Pipes are seen at the Kinder Morgan Trans Mountain facility in Edmonton, Alta., April 6, 2017. (Jonathan Hayward/THE CANADIAN PRESS)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[TransCanada's Keystone Pipeline spill cleanup on schedule]]></title>
    <link>https://www.ctvnews.ca/business/transcanada-s-keystone-pipeline-spill-cleanup-on-schedule-1.3807061</link>
    <description><![CDATA[TransCanada Corp. says cleanup of a massive on-shore oil spill from Keystone Pipeline in South Dakota is halfway finished.]]></description>
    <author></author>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Associated Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.3807061</guid>
    <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 16:22:17 -0500</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 16:22:17 -0500</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="https://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.3807064.1518816049!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[This aerial photo shows spills from TransCanada Corp.'s Keystone pipeline, Friday, Nov. 17, 2017, that leaked an estimated 210,000 gallons of oil onto agricultural land in northeastern South Dakota, near Amherst, S.D. (DroneBase via AP)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
